com.arcrobotics.ftclib.kinematics

Class DifferentialOdometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.kinematics.DifferentialOdometry

  • public class DifferentialOdometry
extends java.lang.Object
    The classfile that performs odometry calculations for a differential drivetrain. For more information on the differential drivebase, see DifferentialDrive.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double odoX
      The x value for the position of the robot.
      double odoY
      The y value for the position of the robot.
      Pose2d robotPose
      The Pose2d of the robot.
      double trackWidth
      The distance between the left and right main wheels on the robot.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DifferentialOdometry()
      Empty constructor.
      DifferentialOdometry(double trackWidth)
      The constructor that specifies the track width of the robot but defaults the position to (0, 0, 0).
      DifferentialOdometry(Pose2d pose, double trackWidth)
      The constructor that specifies the starting position and the track width.

      • odoY

        The y value for the position of the robot.

      • trackWidth

        public double trackWidth
        The distance between the left and right main wheels on the robot. This defaults to 18.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DifferentialOdometry

        public DifferentialOdometry()
        Empty constructor. Position is defaulted to (0, 0, 0) and track width is 18 inches.

      • DifferentialOdometry

        public DifferentialOdometry(double trackWidth)
        The constructor that specifies the track width of the robot but defaults the position to (0, 0, 0).
        Parameters:
        trackWidth - The track width of the robot in inches.

      • DifferentialOdometry

        public DifferentialOdometry(Pose2d pose,
                            double trackWidth)
        The constructor that specifies the starting position and the track width.
        Parameters:
        pose - the starting position of the robot
        trackWidth - the track width of the robot in inches

    • Method Detail

      • updatePose

        public void updatePose(Pose2d newPose)
        Updates the position of the robot.
        Parameters:
        newPose - the new Pose2d

      • rotatePose

        public void rotatePose(double deltaTheta)
        Rotates the heading by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        deltaTheta - the difference between the current heading and the previous heading. Rotates it CCW.

      • updateOdometryCounts

        public void updateOdometryCounts(double xVal,
                                 double yVal)
        Updates the values for odoX and odoY by adding the specified amounts.
        Parameters:
        xVal - the additive x-value
        yVal - the additive y-value

      • update

        public void update(double heading,
                   double leftInches,
                   double rightInches)
        The update method that updates the robot's position over a relatively small amount of time. The update frequency can range in a value of Hz. However many updates that are called per second is the representation of the feedback frequency in Hertz (1/s). If we have a frequency of 60 Hz, then the update method is called 60 times in 1 second. If you have no heading, pass in a value of 0 for each update. If you have no horizontal odometers, pass in a value of 0 for horizontalOdoInches.
        Parameters:
        heading - the current heading of the robot, which might be de-synced with the heading in the robot position.
        leftInches - the number of inches travelled by the left side of the robot.
        rightInches - the number of inches travelled by the right side of the robot.
